definition.name: AI-based PR Reviewer & Summarizer with Chat Capabilities
definition.description: AI-based PR Reviewer & Summarizer with Chat Capabilities
definition.author: CodeRabbit LLC

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: Enable debug mode

inputs.name: max_files
inputs.description: Max files to summarize and review. Less than or equal to 0 means no limit.

inputs.name: review_simple_changes
inputs.description: Review even when the changes are simple

inputs.name: review_comment_lgtm
inputs.description: Leave comments even if the patch is LGTM

inputs.name: path_filters
inputs.description:
The path filters, e.g., "src/**.py", "!dist/**", each line will be considered as one pattern.
See also

- https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-workflows/workflow-syntax-for-github-actions#onpushpull_requestpull_request_targetpathspaths-ignore
- https://github.com/isaacs/minimatch

inputs.name: disable_review
inputs.description: Only provide the summary and skip the code review.

inputs.name: disable_release_notes
inputs.description: Disable release notes

inputs.name: openai_base_url
inputs.description: The url of the openai api interface.

inputs.name: openai_light_model
inputs.description: Model to use for simple tasks like summarizing diff on a file.

inputs.name: openai_heavy_model
inputs.description: Model to use for complex tasks such as code reviews.

inputs.name: openai_model_temperature
inputs.description: Temperature for GPT model

inputs.name: openai_retries
inputs.description: How many times to retry OpenAI API in case of timeouts or errors?

inputs.name: openai_timeout_ms
inputs.description: Timeout for OpenAI API call in millis

inputs.name: openai_concurrency_limit
inputs.description: How many concurrent API calls to make to OpenAI servers?

inputs.name: github_concurrency_limit
inputs.description: How many concurrent API calls to make to GitHub?

inputs.name: system_message
inputs.description: System message to be sent to OpenAI
inputs.default:
You are `@coderabbitai` (aka `github-actions[bot]`), a language model
trained by OpenAI. Your purpose is to act as a highly experienced
software engineer and provide a thorough review of the code hunks
and suggest code snippets to improve key areas such as:
  - Logic
  - Security
  - Performance
  - Data races
  - Consistency
  - Error handling
  - Maintainability
  - Modularity
  - Complexity
  - Optimization
  - Best practices: DRY, SOLID, KISS

Do not comment on minor code style issues, missing
comments/documentation. Identify and resolve significant
concerns to improve overall code quality while deliberately
disregarding minor issues.

inputs.name: summarize
inputs.description: The prompt for final summarization response
inputs.default:
Provide your final response in markdown with the following content:

- **Walkthrough**: A high-level summary of the overall change instead of
  specific files within 80 words.
- **Changes**: A markdown table of files and their summaries. Group files
  with similar changes together into a single row to save space.
- **Poem**: Below the changes, include a whimsical, short poem written by
  a rabbit to celebrate the changes. Format the poem as a quote using
  the ">" symbol and feel free to use emojis where relevant.

Avoid additional commentary as this summary will be added as a comment on the
GitHub pull request. Use the titles "Walkthrough" and "Changes" and they must be H2.

inputs.name: summarize_release_notes
inputs.description: The prompt for generating release notes in the same chat as summarize stage
inputs.default:
Craft concise release notes for the pull request.
Focus on the purpose and user impact, categorizing changes as "New Feature", "Bug Fix",
"Documentation", "Refactor", "Style", "Test", "Chore", or "Revert". Provide a bullet-point list,
e.g., "- New Feature: Added search functionality to the UI". Limit your response to 50-100 words
and emphasize features visible to the end-user while omitting code-level details.

inputs.name: language
inputs.description: ISO code for the response language

inputs.name: bot_icon
inputs.description: The icon for the bot
